title: Astra Film Awards: 'Barbie' Wins Eight Awards, Including Best Film » WhatsNew2Day
text: Among those who came to the Biltmore in downtown Los Angeles to collect honors during a weekend packed with awards season activities leading up to the Golden Globe Awards: Barbie‘s Greta Gerwigwhich collected the awards for best film and best original screenplay, the first with the producer David Haymanwho in turn collected Margot Robbiethe award for best actress; Marcos Ronsonwho accepted best original song (“I’m Just Ken”) and, on behalf of ryan goslingBest Supporting Actor; The color Purple‘s Fantasia Barrino, Danielle Brooks and Colman Domingowho accepted the award for best cast; Are you there God? It’s me, Margaret‘s Kelly Fremon Craig, accepting best comedy film; winner of best adapted screenplay, American fiction‘s Cordon Jefferson; and Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse‘s Hailee Steinfeld. Also present were several people who were presented with previously announced honors: The color Purple‘s Brooks (breakthrough performer award); Blackberry‘s Glenn Howerton (game changer award); poor things‘ Willem Dafoe (award for excellence in art); American fiction‘s Jeffrey Wright (acting achievement award); Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse‘s Daniel Pemberton (craft achievement award), snow society‘s JA Bayona (cinematic career award); and Are you there God? It’s me, Margaret‘s Abby Ryder Fortson (rising star award). Some former HCA members continue to express concerns to journalists about the organization even since its name change, alleging conflicts of interest related to its advisory board, among other things. But it seems that a considerable part of the business is unaffected. Below you will find a complete list of the winners. best image “Barbie” (Warner Bros. Photos) best Actor Paul Giamatti – “The Holdovers” (Focus Features) Best Actress – TIE Lily Gladstone – “The Flower Moon Killers” (Apple Original Movies) Margot Robbie – “Barbie” (Warner Bros. Pictures) Best Supporting Actor Ryan Gosling – “Barbie” (Warner Bros. Pictures) Best Supporting Actress Da’Vine Joy Randolph – “The Holdovers” (Focus Features) best director Christopher Nolan – “Oppenheimer” (Universal Pictures) Best original screenplay “Barbie,” written by Greta Gerwig and Noah Baumbach (Warner Bros. Pictures) Best adapted screenplay “American Fiction”, script by Cord Jefferson (Orion Pictures / Amazon MGM Studios) Best international feature film “Anatomy of a fall” (France) (NEON) Best international actor Gael García Bernal – “Cassandro” (Amazon MGM Studios) Best international actress Sandra Hüller – “Anatomy of a Fall” (NEON) Best international filmmaker Hayao Miyazaki – “The Boy and the Heron” (GKids) Best animated film “Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse” (Sony Pictures) Best Short Film “The After” (Netflix) Best action feature “John Wick: Chapter 4” (Lionsgate) Best comedy film “Are you there God? It’s me, Margaret” (Lionsgate) Best horror movie “M3GAN” (Universal Photos) Best debut film Celine song, “Past Lives” (A24) Best Documentary Feature Film “Still: A Michael J. Pictures) best original song “I’m Just Ken” from “Barbie,” written by Mark Ronson and Andrew Wyatt – Performed by Ryan Gosling (Warner Bros. Pictures) Best photography Hoyte van Hoytema, “Oppenheimer” (Universal Pictures) Best costume design Holly Waddington, “Poor People” (Searchlight Pictures) best edition Nathan Orloff, “John Wick: Chapter 4” (Lionsgate) Best hair and makeup Kazu Hiro, Sian Grigg, Kay Georgiou and Lori McCoy-Bell, “Maestro” (Netflix) Best production design Sarah Greenwood and Katie Spencer, “Barbie” (Warner Bros. Pictures) Best Advertising Campaign “Barbie” (Warner Bros. Photos) Best score “Oppenheimer”, Ludwig Göransson (Universal Pictures) Better sound “Oppenheimer” (Universal Pictures) Better visual effects “Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse” (Sony Pictures) Additionally, the HCA awarded eight honorary awards including: - Abby Ryder Fortson – Rising Star Award - Daniel Pemberton – Artisan Achievement Award - Danielle Brooks – Breakthrough Artist Award - Glenn Howerton – Game Changer Award - JA Bayonne – Film Achievement Award - Jeffrey Wright – Acting Achievement Award - John Wick: Chapter 4 – Featured Award - Willem Dafoe – Award for Excellence in Art The HCA also announced that Yong Chavez has been named co-CEO of the organization. In this new role, Chavez will be responsible for overseeing the organization’s overall operations, including member relations, working with studios, and creating new initiatives for global representation.
